revised_title: Ferrite-Manganite Crystal Distortion and its Dependence on Temperature and Cation Concentration
tldr: The authors examine the crystal distortion in ferrite-manganite systems and find that the degree of distortion depends on temperature and the net fraction of cations forming appropriately orientated bonds in octahedral sites. They propose a mathematical model to explain the distortion and its relationship to the concentration of distorting cations and temperature. Their findings help to understand the causes of crystal distortion in spinel-like substances.
